reducing deforestation and degradation is significant,
Over the last decade, hundreds of subnational initiatives that aim to reduce deforestation
related emissions have been implemented across the tropics (Section 7.6). Reduced deforestation is a
significant piece of the NDCs in the P
. Conservation of forests provides multiple co
services, biodiversity and sustainable development (Section 7.6.). Still, ensuring good governance,
accountability (e.g. enhanced monitoring and verification capacity;
, and the rule of law are
based mitigation options. In many countries with the highest
deforestation rates, insecure land rights often are significant barriers for forest
Afforestation, reforestation and forest ecosystem restoration
benefits, risks and implementation opportunities and barriers
reforestation (A/R) are activities that convert land to forest, where reforestation is on land that has
previously contained forests, while afforestation is on land that historically has not been forested (Box
ers to a form of reforestation that gives more priority to ecological integrity
as well, even though it can still be a managed forest. Depending on the location, scale, and choice and
management of tree species, A/R activities have a wide variety of co
planned, sustainable reforestation and forest restoration can enhance climate resilience and biodiversity,
and provide a variety of ecosystem services including water regulation, microclimatic regulation, soil
as well as renewable resources, income and livelihoods
k et al. 2020; Stanturf et al. 2015)
Afforestation, when well planned, can help address
land degradation and desertification by reducing runoff and erosion and lead to cloud formation
however, when not well planned, there are localised trade

affect food security since an increase in global forest area can increase food prices through land
